DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety efficacy AL-46383A Ophthalmic Solution treatment adenoviral conjunctivitis .
DOC.brief_title: An Evaluation Efficacy Safety AL-46383A Ophthalmic Solution Treatment Adenoviral Conjunctivitis
DOC.criteria: At least one eye must EITHER positive adenovirus test ( use Adeno Detector™ Adenoviral Conjunctivitis , Rapid Pathogen Screening , Inc. ) OR positive clinical diagnosis assess Adenoviral Clinical Diagnostic Checklist . Onset development ocular symptom and/or sign conjunctivitis ≤ 7 day prior enrollment ( Day 1 ) either eye . Able understand sign inform consent form approve Institutional Review Board/ Independent Ethics Committee ( IRB/IEC ) . Must agree comply visit schedule requirement study . Females pregnant lactating . All female childbearing potential ( premenarcheal , postmenopausal surgically sterile ) may participate negative urine pregnancy test prior randomization , agree use adequate birth control method prevent pregnancy throughout study . Other protocoldefined inclusion criterion may apply . Subepithelial infiltrates Day 1 visit either eye . Corneal opacity corneal abnormality Day 1 visit either eye . Contact lens wear course study . Participants require correction must spectacles appropriate correction . Only one sight eye vision either eye correctable 0.6 good logMAR ( use ETDRS chart ) Day 1 visit . Abnormal finding posterior pole retina medium opacity find dilate fundus examination Day 1 ( Screening/ Baseline ) visit . Suspected fungal , herpes , Chlamydia Acanthamoeba infection , base clinical observation . History active uveitis iritis either eye . History corneal transplant either eye . Presence nasolacrimal duct obstruction Day 1 . Use specified prohibited medication . Other protocoldefined exclusion criterion may apply .
